org.dyn4j.collision.narrowphase

Class Sat

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dyn4j.collision.narrowphase.Sat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NarrowphaseDetector

    public class Sat
extends java.lang.Object
implements NarrowphaseDetector
    Implementation of the Separating Axis Theorem (SAT) for penetration detection.

    Sat states that "if two Convex objects are not penetrating, there exists an axis for which the projection of the objects does not overlap."

    Get all the separating axes for the first Shape, which are given by retrieving the normal ( or perpendicular Vector2) of each edge of the Shape. Project both Shapes onto each axis, if any projection does not overlap, then there is no collision.
    If none of the above axes fail, then do the same process on the second Shape.
    If both of the above do not fail then there is a collision.

    If there is a collision, one can obtain the penetration Vector2 and depth from scaling the axis by the projection overlap.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    3.0.2
    Author:
    William Bittle
